member.summary: Describes a calling card

member.summary: String that describes the card in a user-friendly manner.

member.summary: Number of digits in the existing card number. The card number itself is not returned for security reasons (it is stored in scrambled form by TAPI). The application can use this to insert filler bytes into a text control in "password" mode to show that a number exists.

member.summary: The dialing rules applied to calls placed within the same area code.

member.summary: The dialing rules applied to calls identified as long distance within the same country code.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallingCard.InternationalRules
member.summary: The dialing rules applied to calls outside the country.

member.summary: Known features

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Returns a System.String representing this object

member.name: P:JulMar.Atapi.CallingCard.IsHidden
member.summary: This calling card has been hidden by the user. It is not shown by Dial Helper in the main listing of available calling cards, but will be shown in the list of cards from which dialing rules can be copied.

member.name: P:JulMar.Atapi.CallingCard.IsPredefined
member.summary: This calling card is one of the predefined calling card definitions included with Telephony by Microsoft. It cannot be removed entirely using Dial Helper; if the user attempts to remove it, it will become HIDDEN. It thus continues to be accessible for copying of dialing rules.

member.summary: Preferred Calling card id

member.summary: The access code to be dialed before calls to long-distance addresses.

member.summary: String containing the dial digits and modifier characters that should be prefixed to the dialable string to cancel call waiting for this location.

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:JulMar.Atapi.CallingLocation.ToString
member.summary: This provides an override for the ToString method.

member.name: P:JulMar.Atapi.CallingLocation.TollPrefixes
member.summary: The toll prefix list for the location. The string array contains only prefixes consisting of the digits "0" through "9".

member.name: P:JulMar.Atapi.CallingLocation.CanPulseDial
member.summary: The default dialing mode at this location is pulse dialing. If this returns true, then TranslateAddress will insert a "P" dial modifier at the beginning of the dialable string returned when this location is selected. Otherwise, TranslateAddress will insert a "T" dial modifier at the beginning of the dialable string.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.Country
member.summary: This class represents a single country identified by TAPI dialing rules.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.Country.Id
member.summary: Country/region identifier of the entry. The country/region identifier is an internal identifier that allows multiple entries to exist in the country/region list with the same country/region code, for example, all countries or regions in North America and the Caribbean share the country/region code 1, but require separate entries in the list.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.Country.CountryCode
member.summary: Country/region code of the country/region represented by the entry; that is, the digits dialed in an international call. Only this value should be displayed to users. Country/region identifiers should never be displayed

member.summary: Number of seconds, after the completion of dialing, that the call should wait in the PROCEEDING or RINGBACK state, before abandoned by the service provider with a LINECALLSTATE_DISCONNECTED and LINEDISCONNECTMODE_NOANSWER. A value of zero indicates that the application does not desire automatic call abandonment.

member.summary: Maximum amount of time to wait for a dial tone when a 'W' is used in the dialable address, in milliseconds.

member.summary: The originator identity should be concealed (block caller ID).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MakeCallParams.TakeDestinationOffhook
member.summary: The called party's phone should be automatically taken offhook.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MakeCallParams.TakeOriginationOffhook
member.summary: The caller party's phone should be automatically taken offhook.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MakeCallParams.WantPredictiveDialing
member.summary: This flag is used only when placing a call on an address with predictive dialing capability (LINEADDRCAPFLAGS_PREDICTIVEDIALER is on in the dwAddrCapFlags member in LINEADDRESSCAPS). The flag must be on to enable the enhanced call progress and/or media device monitoring capabilities of the device. If this bit is not on, the call will be placed without enhanced call progress or media type monitoring, and no automatic transfer will be initiated based on call state.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MakeCallParams.OriginateOnIdleCall
member.summary: The call should be originated on an idle call appearance and not join a call in progress. When using the lineMakeCall function, if the IDLE value is not set and there is an existing call on the line, the function breaks into the existing call if necessary to make the new call. If there is no existing call, the function makes the new call as specified

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MakeCallParams.WantSecureCall
member.summary: The call should be set up as secure.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes
member.summary: These modes are used to select a certain quality of service for the requested connection from the underlying telephone network. Bearer modes available on a given line are a device capability of the line.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.Voice
member.summary: This is a regular 3.1 kHz analog voice-grade bearer service. Bit integrity is not assured. Voice can support fax and modem media types.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.Speech
member.summary: This corresponds to G.711 speech transmission on the call. The network can use processing techniques such as analog transmission, echo cancellation, and compression/decompression. Bit integrity is not assured. Speech is not intended to support fax and modem media types.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.MultiUse
member.summary: The multiuse mode defined by ISDN.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.Data
member.summary: The unrestricted data transfer on the call. The data rate is specified separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.AlternateSpeechData
member.summary: The alternate transfer of speech or unrestricted data on the same call (ISDN).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.NonCallSignaling
member.summary: This corresponds to a non-call-associated signaling connection from the application to the service provider or switch.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.Passthrough
member.summary: When a call is active in LINEBEARERMODE_PASSTHROUGH, the service provider gives direct access to the attached hardware for control by the application. This mode is used primarily by applications desiring temporary direct control over asynchronous modems, accessed through the Win32 communication functions, for the purpose of configuring or using special features not otherwise supported by the service provider.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BearerModes.RestrictedData
member.summary: Bearer service for digital data in which only the low-order seven bits of each octet may contain user data (for example, for Switched 56kbit/s service).

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.MediaModes
member.summary: These constants describe media types (or modes) of a communications session or call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MediaModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MediaModes.Unknown
member.summary: A media stream exists but its mode is not currently known and may become known later. This would correspond to a call with an unclassified media type. In typical analog telephony environments, an incoming call's media type may be unknown until after the call has been answered and the media stream has been filtered to make a determination. If the unknown media-mode flag is set, other media flags can also be set. This is used to signify that the media is unknown but that it is likely to be one of the other selected media types.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MediaModes.InteractiveVoice
member.summary: Voice energy was detected on the call, and the call is handled as an interactive voice call with humans on both ends.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MediaModes.AutomatedVoice
member.summary: Voice energy was detected on the call, and the voice is locally handled by an automated application such as with an answering machine application. When a service provider cannot distinguish between interactive and automated voice on an incoming call, it will report the call as interactive voice.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.MediaModes.DataModem
member.summary: A data modem session on the call. Current modem protocols require the called station to initiate the handshake. For an incoming data modem call, the application can typically make no positive detection. How the service provider makes this determination is its choice. For example, a period of silence just after answering an incoming call can be used as a heuristic to decide that this might be a data modem call.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.CallState
member.summary: The call states for a given TapiCall

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.None
member.summary: No call-state available

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Idle
member.summary: The call exists but has not been connected. No activity exists on the call. This means that no call is currently active. A call can never transition out of the idle state.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Offering
member.summary: The call is being offered to the station, signaling the arrival of a new call. The offering state is not the same as causing a phone or computer to ring. In some environments, a call in the offering state does not ring the user until the switch instructs the line to ring. For example this state is in use when an incoming call appears on several station sets but only the primary address rings. The instruction to ring does not affect any call states.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Accepted
member.summary: The call was in the offering state and has been accepted. This indicates to other, monitoring, applications that the current owner application has claimed responsibility for answering the call. In ISDN, the accepted state is entered when the called-party equipment sends a message to the switch indicating that it is willing to present the call to the called person. This has the side effect of alerting (ringing) the users at both ends of the call. An incoming call can always be immediately answered without first being separately accepted.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Dialtone
member.summary: The call is receiving a dial tone from the switch. This means that the switch is ready to receive a dialed number.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Dialing
member.summary: The originator is dialing digits on the call. The dialed digits are collected by the switch.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Ringback
member.summary: The station to be called has been reached, and the destination's switch is generating a ring tone back to the originator. A ringback means that the destination address is being alerted to the call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Busy
member.summary: The call is receiving a busy tone. A busy tone indicates that the call cannot be completed. This occurs if either a circuit (trunk) or the remote party's station are in use.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.SpecialInfo
member.summary: The call is receiving a special information signal that precedes a prerecorded announcement indicating why a call cannot be completed.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Connected
member.summary: The call has been established and the connection is made. Information is able to flow over the call between the originating address and the destination address.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Proceeding
member.summary: Dialing has completed and the call is proceeding through the switch or telephone network. This occurs after dialing is complete and before the call reaches the dialed party, as indicated by ringback, busy, or answer.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.OnHold
member.summary: The call is on hold by the switch. This frees the physical line. This allows another call to use the line.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Conferenced
member.summary: The call is a member of a conference call and is logically in the connected state.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.OnHoldPendingConference
member.summary: The call is currently on hold while it is being added to a conference.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.OnHoldPendingTransfer
member.summary: The call is currently on hold awaiting transfer to another number.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Disconnected
member.summary: The remote party has disconnected from the call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallState.Unknown
member.summary: The call exists, but its state is currently unknown. This may be the result of poor call progress detection by the service provider. A call state message with the call state set to unknown may also be generated to inform the TAPI DLL about a new call at a time when the actual call state of the call is not exactly known

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.ConnectModes
member.summary: These bit-flag constants describe different substates of a connected call. A mode is available as call status to the application after the call state transitions to connected, and within the LINE_CALLSTATE message indicating the call is in LINECALLSTATE_CONNECTED. These values are used when the call is on an address that is shared (bridged) with other stations primarily electronic key systems.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ConnectModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ConnectModes.Active
member.summary: Indicates that the call is connected at the current station (the current station is a participant in the call). If the call state mode is zero (0), the application should assume that the value is "active" This would be the situation on a non-bridged address. The mode can switch between ACTIVE and INACTIVE during a call if the user joins and leaves the call through manual action. In such a bridged situation, a or function call may possibly not actually drop the call or place it on hold, because the status of other stations on the call may govern. For example, attempting to "hold" a call when other stations are participating won't be possible. Instead, the call may simply be changed to the INACTIVE mode if it remains CONNECTED at other stations.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ConnectModes.Inactive
member.summary: Indicates that the call is active at one or more other stations, but the current station is not a participant in the call. If the call state mode is ZERO, the application should assume that the value is "active". This would be the situation on a non-bridged address. A call in the INACTIVE state can be joined using Answer. Many operations that are valid in calls in the CONNECTED state can be impossible in the INACTIVE mode, such as monitoring for tones and digits, because the station is not actually participating in the call; monitoring is usually suspended, although not canceled, while the call is in the INACTIVE mode.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ConnectModes.ActiveHeld
member.summary: Indicates that the station is an active participant in the call, but that the remote party has placed the call on hold. The other party considers the call to be in the onhold state. Normally, such information is available only when both endpoints of the call fall within the same switching domain.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ConnectModes.InactiveHeld
member.summary: Indicates that the station is not an active participant in the call, and that the remote party has placed the call on hold.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ConnectModes.Confirmed
member.summary: Indicates that the service provider received affirmative notification that the call has entered the connected state. For example, the notification was received through answer supervision or similar mechanisms.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes
member.summary: These bit-flag constants describe different reasons for a remote disconnect request. A disconnect mode is available as call status to the application after the call state transitions to disconnected.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Normal
member.summary: This is a normal disconnect request by the remote party. The call was terminated normally.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Unknown
member.summary: The reason for the disconnect request is unknown but may become known later.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Reject
member.summary: The remote user has rejected the call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Pickup
member.summary: The call was picked up from elsewhere.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Forwarded
member.summary: The call was forwarded by the switch.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Busy
member.summary: The remote user's station is busy.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.NoAnswer
member.summary: The remote user's station does not answer.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.BadAddress
member.summary: The destination address is invalid.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Unreachable
member.summary: The remote user could not be reached.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Congestion
member.summary: The network is congested.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Incompatible
member.summary: The remote user's station equipment is incompatible with the type of call requested.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Unavailable
member.summary: The reason for the disconnect is unavailable and will not become known later.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.NoDialtone
member.summary: A dial tone was not detected within a service-provider defined timeout, at a point during dialing when one was expected (such as at a "W" in the dialable string).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.NumberChanged
member.summary: The call could not be connected because the destination number has been changed, but automatic redirection to the new number is not provided.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.OutOfOrder
member.summary: The call could not be connected or was disconnected because the destination device is out of order. This could occur if for example there were hardware failure.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.TemporaryFailure
member.summary: The call could not be connected or was disconnected because of a temporary failure in the network; the call can be reattempted later and is expected to eventually complete.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.QosUnavailable
member.summary: The call could not be connected or was disconnected because the minimum quality of service could not be obtained or sustained.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Blocked
member.summary: The call could not be connected because calls from the origination address are not being accepted at the destination address. This differs from Rejected in that blocking is implemented in the network (a passive reject) while a rejection is implemented in the destination equipment (an active reject). The blocking can be due to a specific exclusion of the origination address, or because the destination accepts calls from only a selected set of origination address (closed user group). This is appropriate as a blacklisted response. For example, a modem has received an answer, gone more than six seconds without detecting Ringback, failed to connect a defined number of times, determines that the phone number is not valid to call, and issues a 'blacklisted' response.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.DoNotDisturb
member.summary: The call could not be connected because the destination has invoked the Do Not Disturb feature.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DisconnectModes.Canceled
member.summary: The call was cancelled.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.BusyModes
member.summary: These bit-flag constants describe different busy signals that the switch or network can generate. These busy signals typically indicate that a different resource that is required to make a call is currently in use.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BusyModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BusyModes.Station
member.summary: The busy signal indicates that the called party's station is busy. This is usually signaled with a normal busy tone.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BusyModes.Trunk
member.summary: The busy signal indicates that a trunk or circuit is busy. This is usually signaled with a fast busy tone.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BusyModes.Unknown
member.summary: The busy signal's specific mode is currently unknown but may become known later.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.BusyModes.Unavailable
member.summary: The busy signal's specific mode is unavailable and will not become known.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.DialtoneModes
member.summary: These bit-flag constants describe different types of dial tones which may be presented when the caller picks up a handset.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DialtoneModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DialtoneModes.Normal
member.summary: This is a normal dial tone, which typically is a continuous tone.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DialtoneModes.Special
member.summary: This is a special dial tone indicating that a certain condition, known by the switch or network, is currently in effect. Special dial tones typically use an interrupted tone. As with a normal dial tone, this indicates that the switch is ready to receive the number to be dialed.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DialtoneModes.Internal
member.summary: This is an internal dial tone, as within a PBX.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DialtoneModes.External
member.summary: This is an external (public network) dial tone.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DialtoneModes.Unknown
member.summary: The dial tone mode is not currently known but may become known later.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DialtoneModes.Unavailable
member.summary: The dial tone mode is unavailable and will not become known.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.OfferingModes
member.summary: These bit-flag constants describe different substates of an offering call. A mode is available as call status to the application after the call state transitions to offering, and within the LINE_CALLSTATE message indicating the call is in LINECALLSTATE_OFFERING. These values are used when the call is on an address that is shared (bridged) with other stations, primarily electronic key systems.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.OfferingModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.OfferingModes.Active
member.summary: Indicates that the call is alerting at the current station and if any application is set up to automatically answer, it can do so. If the call state mode is ZERO, the application should assume that the value is active. This would be the situation on a non-bridged address.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.OfferingModes.Inactive
member.summary: Indicates that the call is being offered at more than one station, but the current station is not alerting. For example, it may be an attendant station where the offering status is advisory, such as blinking a light. Software at the station set for automatic answering should preferably not answer the call, because this should be the prerogative at the primary (alerting) station, but TapiCall.Answer may be used to connect the call.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.SpecialInfoModes
member.summary: These bit-flag constants describes special information signals that the network can use to report various reporting and network observation operations. They are special coded tone sequences transmitted at the beginning of network advisory recorded announcements.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.SpecialInfoModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.SpecialInfoModes.NoCircuit
member.summary: This special information tone precedes a no circuit or an emergency announcement. These announcements are in the trunk blockage category.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.SpecialInfoModes.CustomerIrregularity
member.summary: This special information tone precedes a vacant number, AIS, Centrex number change and nonworking station, access code not dialed or dialed in error, or manual intercept operator message. These conditions are in the customer irregularity category. This is also reported when billing information is rejected and when the dialed address is blocked at the switch.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.SpecialInfoModes.Reorder
member.summary: This special information tone precedes a reorder announcement. This announcement is in the equipment irregularity category. This is also reported when the telephone is kept offhook too long.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.SpecialInfoModes.Unknown
member.summary: Specifics about the special information tone are currently unknown but may become known later.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.SpecialInfoModes.Unavailable
member.summary: Specifics about the special information tone are unavailable and will not become known.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.DigitModes
member.summary: These constants describe different types of inband digit generation.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitModes.Pulse
member.summary: Uses rotary pulse sequences to signal digits. Valid digits are zero (0) through 9.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitModes.Dtmf
member.summary: Uses DTMF tones to signal digits. Valid digits are zero (0) through 9, '*', '#', 'A', 'B', 'C', and 'D'.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitModes.DtmfEnd
member.summary: Uses DTMF tones to signal digits and detect the down edges. Valid digits are zero (0) through 9, '*', '#', 'A', 'B', 'C', and 'D'.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.DigitGatherComplete
member.summary: These bit-flag constants describe the conditions under which buffered digit gathering is terminated.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitGatherComplete.None
member.summary: No value

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitGatherComplete.BufferFull
member.summary: The requested number of digits has been gathered. The buffer is full.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitGatherComplete.DigitTermination
member.summary: One of the termination digits matched a received digit. The matched termination digit is the last digit in the buffer.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitGatherComplete.FirstTimeout
member.summary: The first digit timeout expired. The buffer contains no digits.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitGatherComplete.InterDigitTimeout
member.summary: The inter-digit timeout expired. The buffer contains at least one digit.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.DigitGatherComplete.Canceled
member.summary: The request was canceled by this application, by another application, or because the call terminated.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.RoamingModes.Unavailable

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.RoamingModes.Home

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.RoamingModes.RoamingCarrierA

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.RoamingModes.RoamingCarrierB

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.AddressSharingModes
member.summary: The various ways an address can be shared between lines.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.AddressSharingModes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.AddressSharingModes.BridgedExclusive
member.summary: The address is bridged to one or more other stations. The first line to activate a call on the line will have exclusive access to the address and calls that may exist on it. Other lines will not be able to use the bridged address while it is in use.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.AddressSharingModes.BridgedNew
member.summary: The address is bridged with one or more other stations. The first line to activate a call on the line will have exclusive access to only the corresponding call. Other applications that use the address will result in new and separate call appearances.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.AddressSharingModes.BridgedShared
member.summary: The address is bridged with one or more other lines. All bridged parties can share in calls on the address, which then functions as a conference.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.AddressSharingModes.Monitored
member.summary: This is an address whose idle/busy status is made available to this line.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.AddressSharingModes.Private
member.summary: The address is private to the user's line. It is not assigned to any other station.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins
member.summary: The origins for a given call

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins.Unknown
member.summary: The call origin is currently unknown but may become known later.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins.Unavailable
member.summary: The call origin is not available and will never become known for this call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins.Outbound
member.summary: The call originated from this station as an outgoing call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins.Inbound
member.summary: The call originated as an incoming call, but the service provider is unable to determine whether it came from another station on the same switch or from an external line.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins.Internal
member.summary: The call originated as an incoming call at a station internal to the same switching environment.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins.External
member.summary: The call originated as an incoming call on an external line.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallOrigins.Conference
member.summary: The call is a conference call. That is, it is the application's connection to the conference bridge in the switch.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons
member.summary: The reason for a call

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Direct
member.summary: This is a direct incoming or outgoing call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.BusyForward
member.summary: This call was forwarded from another extension that was busy at the time of the call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.NoAnswerForward
member.summary: The call was forwarded from another extension that didn't answer the call after some number of rings.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.UnconditionalForward
member.summary: The call was forwarded unconditionally from another number.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Pickup
member.summary: The call was picked up from another extension.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Unpark
member.summary: The call was retrieved as a parked call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Redirect
member.summary: The call was redirected to this station.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.CallCompletion
member.summary: The call was the result of a call completion request.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Transfer
member.summary: The call has been transferred from another number.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Reminder
member.summary: The call is a reminder, or "recall", that the user has a call parked or on hold for potentially a long time.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Unknown
member.summary: The reason for the call is currently unknown but may become known later.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Unavailable
member.summary: The reason for the call is unavailable and will not become known later.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Intrude
member.summary: The call intruded onto the line, either by a call completion action invoked by another station or by operator action. Depending on switch implementation, the call may appear either in the connected state, or conferenced with an existing active call on the line.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.Parked
member.summary: The call was parked on the address. Usually, it appears initially in the onhold state.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.CampedOn
member.summary: The call was camped on the address. Usually, it appears initially in the onhold state, and can be switched to using SwapHold. If an active call becomes idle, the camped-on call may change to the offering state and the device start ringing.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallReasons.RouteRequest
member.summary: The call appears on the address because the switch needs routing instructions from the application. The application should examine the CalledID member and use the Redirect method to provide a new dialable address for the call. If the call is to be blocked instead, the application may call Drop. If the application fails to take action within a switch-defined timeout period, a default action will be taken.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallInfoChangeTypes.Other

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallInfoChangeTypes.DeviceSpecificData

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallInfoChangeTypes.BearerMode

member.summary: The application's use of the phone is temporarily suspended.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.PhoneStateChangeTypes.Resume
member.summary: The application's use of the phone device is resumed after having been suspended for some time.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.PhoneStateChangeTypes.DevSpecific
member.summary: The phone's device-specific information has changed.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.PhoneStateChangeTypes.Reinit
member.summary: Items have changed in the configuration of phone devices. To become aware of these changes, as for the appearance of new phone devices, the application should reinitialize its use of TAPI.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.PhoneStateChangeTypes.CapabilitiesChanged
member.summary: Indicates that, due to configuration changes made by the user or other circumstances, one or more of the members in the PHONECAPS structure have changed. The application should read the updated structure. If a service provider sends a PHONE_STATE message containing this value to TAPI, TAPI will pass it along to applications that have negotiated TAPI version 1.4 or later; applications negotiating a previous API version will receive PHONE_STATE messages specifying PHONESTATE_REINIT, requiring them to shut down and reinitialize their connection to TAPI to obtain the updated information.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.PhoneStateChangeTypes.Removed
member.summary: Indicates that the device is being removed from the system by the service provider, most likely through user action, through a control panel, or through a similar utility. A Removed message will normally be immediately followed by a Closed message on the device. Subsequent attempts to access the device prior to TAPI being reinitialized will result in PHONEERR_NODEVICE being returned to the application. If a service provider sends a PHONE_STATE message containing this value to TAPI, TAPI will pass it along to applications that have negotiated TAPI version 1.4 or later. Applications negotiating a previous API version will not receive any notification.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.TranslationOptions
member.summary: These are options used in .

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.TranslationOptions.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.TranslationOptions.CancelCallWaiting
member.summary: If a Cancel Call Waiting string is defined for the location, setting this bit will cause that string to be inserted at the beginning of the dialable string. This is commonly used by data modem and fax applications to prevent interruption of calls by call waiting beeps. If no Cancel Call Waiting string is defined for the location, this bit has no affect.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.TranslationOptions.ForceLongDistanceCall
member.summary: This option forces the address (number) to be translated as long distance.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.TranslationOptions.ForceLocalCall
member.summary: This option forces the number (address) to be translated as local.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.CallCompletionMode
member.summary: These describe different ways in which a call can be completed

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallCompletionMode.None
member.summary: No completion

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallCompletionMode.Callback
member.summary: Requests the called station to return the call when it returns to idle

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallCompletionMode.Campon
member.summary: Queues the call until the call can be completed.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallCompletionMode.Intrude
member.summary: Adds the application to the existing call at the called station (barge in).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.CallCompletionMode.Message
member.summary: Leaves a short predefined message for the called station (Leave Word Calling). The message to be sent is specified separately.

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode
member.summary: Describes the different types of forwarding which may be applied to lines or addresses. This is used by the structure.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.Unconditional
member.summary: Forward all calls unconditionally, irrespective of their origin. Use this value when unconditional forwarding for internal and external calls cannot be controlled separately. Unconditional forwarding overrides forwarding on busy and/or no answer conditions.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.UnconditionalInternal
member.summary: Forward all internal calls unconditionally. Use this value when unconditional forwarding for internal and external calls can be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.UnconditionalExternal
member.summary: Forward all external calls unconditionally. Use this value when unconditional forwarding for internal and external calls can be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.UnconditionaSpecific
member.summary: Unconditionally forward all calls that originated at a specified address (selective call forwarding).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.Busy
member.summary: Forward all calls on busy, irrespective of their origin. Use this value when forwarding for internal and external calls on busy and on no answer cannot be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.BusyInternal
member.summary: Forward all internal calls on busy. Use this value when forwarding for internal and external calls on busy and on no answer can be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.BusyExternal
member.summary: Forward all external calls on busy. Use this value when forwarding for internal and external calls on busy and on no answer can be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.BusySpecific
member.summary: Forward on busy all calls that originated at a specified address (selective call forwarding).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.NoAnswer
member.summary: Forward all calls on no answer, irrespective of their origin. Use this value when call forwarding for internal and external calls on no answer cannot be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.NoAnswerInternal
member.summary: Forward all internal calls on no answer. Use this value when forwarding for internal and external calls on no answer can be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.NoAnswerExternal
member.summary: Forward all external calls on no answer. Use this value when forwarding for internal and external calls on no answer can be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.NoAnswerSpecific
member.summary: Forward on no answer all calls that originated at a specified address (selective call forwarding).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.BusyNoAnswer
member.summary: Forward all calls on busy/no answer, irrespective of their origin. Use this value when forwarding for internal and external calls on busy and on no answer cannot be controlled separately.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.BusyNoAnswerInternal
member.summary: Forward all internal calls on busy/no answer. Use this value when call forwarding on busy and on no answer cannot be controlled separately for internal calls.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.BusyNoAnswerExternal
member.summary: Forward all external calls on busy/no answer. Use this value when call forwarding on busy and on no answer cannot be controlled separately for internal calls.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.BusyNoAnswerSpecific
member.summary: Forward on busy/no answer all calls that originated at a specified address (selective call forwarding).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.Unknown
member.summary: Calls are forwarded, but the conditions under which forwarding will occur are not known at this time. It is possible that the conditions may become known at a future time. (TAPI versions 1.4 and later)

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ForwardingMode.Unavailable
member.summary: Forward on no answer all calls that originated at a specified address (selective call forwarding).

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction
member.summary: Commonly defined button functions. These button functions can be used to invoke the corresponding function from the switch using DeviceSpecificFeature. Note that TAPI does not define the semantics of the button functions; it only provides access to the corresponding function. The behavior associated with each of the function values above is generic and can vary based on the telephony environment
member.remarks: Note that vendors can add their own extensions and the value may not be present here.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Unknown
member.summary: A "dummy" function assignment that indicates that the exact function of the button is unknown or has not been assigned.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Conference
member.summary: Initiates a conference call or adds a call to a conference call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Transfer
member.summary: Initiates a call transfer or completes the transfer of a call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Drop
member.summary: Drops the active call

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Hold
member.summary: Places the active call on hold.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Recall
member.summary: Unholds a call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects a call, such as after initiating a transfer.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Reconnect
member.summary: Reconnects a call that is on consultation hold.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.MessageWaitOn
member.summary: Turns on a message waiting lamp.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.MessageWaitOff
member.summary: Turns off a message waiting lamp.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.SelectRing
member.summary: Allows the user to select the ring pattern of the phone.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.AbbreviatedDial
member.summary: The number to be dialed will be indicated using a short, abbreviated number consisting of one digit or a few digits.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Forward
member.summary: Initiates or changes call forwarding to this phone.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Pickup
member.summary: Picks up a call ringing on another phone.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.RingAgain
member.summary: Initiates a request to be notified if a call cannot be completed normally because of a busy signal or no answer.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Park
member.summary: Parks the active call on another phone, placing it on hold there.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Reject
member.summary: Rejects an incoming call before the call has been answered.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Redirect

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Mute

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.VolumeDown
member.summary: Decreases the volume of audio through the phone's handset speaker or speakerphone.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.SpeakerOn
member.summary: Turns the phone's external speaker on.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.SpeakerOff
member.summary: Turns the phone's external speaker off.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Flash
member.summary: Generates the equivalent of an onhook/offhook sequence. A flash typically indicates that any digits typed next are to be understood as commands to the switch. On many switches, places an active call on consultation hold.

member.summary: Indicates that the next call is a data call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.DataOff
member.summary: Indicates that the next call is not a data call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Busy
member.summary: Makes the phone appear "busy" to incoming calls.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.SelectCall
member.summary: Selects a particular call appearance.

member.summary: Forwards all calls destined for this phone to another phone used for coverage.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.RepertoryDial
member.summary: Repertory dialingthe number to be dialed is provided as a shorthand following pressing of this button.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.SetReperatoryDial

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.SystemSpeed
member.summary: The number to be dialed is provided as a shorthand following pressing of this button. The mappings for system speed dialing are configured inside the switch.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.StationSpeed
member.summary: The number to be dialed is provided as a shorthand following pressing of this button. The mappings for station speed dialing are specific to this station (phone).

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.CampOn
member.summary: Camps-on an extension that returns a busy indication. When the remote station returns to idle, the phone will be rung with a distinctive patterns. Picking up the local phone reinitiates the call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.SaveRepeat
member.summary: When pressed while a call or call attempt is active, it will remember that call's number or command. When pressed while no call is active (such as during dial tone), it repeats the most saved command.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.QueueCall
member.summary: Queues a call to an outside number after it encounters a trunk-busy indication. When a trunk becomes later available, the phone will be rung with a distinctive pattern. Picking up the local phone reinitiates the call.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.None
member.summary: A "dummy" function assignment that indicates that the button does not have a function.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.ButtonFunction.Send
member.summary: Send the call to a directed destination

member.name: T:JulMar.Atapi.LampMode

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.LampMode.Dummy

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.LampMode.Steady
member.summary: Steady means the lamp is continuously lit.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.LampMode.Wink
member.summary: Wink means normal rate on and off.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.LampMode.Flash
member.summary: Flash means slow on and off.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.LampMode.Flutter
member.summary: Flutter means fast on and off.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.LampMode.BrokenFlutter
member.summary: Broken flutter is the superposition of flash and flutter.

member.name: F:JulMar.Atapi.LampMode.Unknown

member.summary: Specifies whether media-control operations are available for calls at this line.

member.summary: Specifies whether is able to deal with multiple addresses at once (inverse multiplexing).

member.name: P:JulMar.Atapi.LineCapabilities.DropsActiveCallsOnClose
member.summary: Specifies what happens when an open line is closed while the application has calls active on the line. If true, the service provider clears all active calls on the line when the last application that has opened the line closes it. If false, the service provider does not drop active calls in such cases. Instead, the calls remain active and under control of external devices. A service provider typically sets this to false if there is some other device that can keep the call alive, for example, if an analog line has the computer and phone set both connect directly to them in a party-line configuration, the offhook phone will automatically keep the call active even after the computer powers down. Applications should check this flag to determine whether to warn the user (with an OK/Cancel dialog box) that active calls will be lost.

member.name: P:JulMar.Atapi.LineStatus.Locked
member.summary: Indicates whether the line is locked or unlocked. This bit is most often used with line devices associated with cellular phones. Many cellular phones have a security mechanism that requires the entry of a password to enable the phone to place calls. This bit can be used to indicate to applications that the phone is locked and cannot place calls until the password is entered on the user interface of the phone so that the application can present an appropriate alert to the user.

member.name: P:JulMar.Atapi.LineStatus.Connected
member.summary: Specifies whether the line is connected to TAPI. If true, the line is connected and TAPI is able to operate on the line device. If false, the line is disconnected and the application is unable to control the line device through TAPI.
